image.altText: An image of a phone screen with a text message.

props.synopsis: Italian osteopath Daniele Caminiti is found to have sexually assaulted a Canberra patient before boarding a flight to Italy just days after his workplace began an investigation.

title.children: 'Jeopardise my entire career': Osteopath texts patient after assault

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: Police charged the 30-year-old with attempted murder after a man's fingers were cut off by a machete. His application for bail was refused.

title.children: Man accused of attempted murder with machete denied bail

image.altText: An old black and white photo of sevevn people on horses.

props.synopsis: The Eddison family suffered terrible loss during World War II. A plaque near a Canberra shopping centre car park offers an insight into that moment in history.

title.children: The tragic reason Walter Eddison never answered his telephone

image.altText: An airborne drone carrying a parcel.

props.synopsis: Drone deliveries are not attracting many complaints but experts say that is not a sign of the public's endorsement due to the difficulty of lodging a grievance.

title.children: 'Disruptive, irritating and excessive': Documents detail drone delivery complaints

image.altText: A woman with classes in a green suit.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Institute of Technology appoints a new chief executive, a year after Leanne Cover resigned and was found to have engaged in corrupt conduct in her handling of consultancy contracts.

title.children: CIT hires new CEO following corruption saga

image.altText: A group of people wearing pink walk on a trail.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Canberrans take part in a solidarity walk to show support for a woman who was allegedly grabbed from behind and assaulted while running at Oak Hill near the Mulligan's Flat Nature Reserve in Bonner last Monday.

title.children: Hundreds walk in solidarity after attack on running woman

image.altText: A man in his late 20s with dark brown hair, smiling, sitting in farming equipment

props.synopsis: When former Canberra Raiders player and farmer Luke Bateman joined TikTok, he went viral for his love of fantasy novels. A month later he announced a book deal, but the news has generated controversy.

title.children: Luke Bateman went viral and got a book deal. Then the tide turned

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court

props.synopsis: Kyle Hiscox broke into Domestic Animal Services ACT to steal his own dog Nova, and then attacked a housemate with a hockey stick, leaving the victim so scarred they left Canberra.

title.children: Man sentenced for attacking housemate, stealing dog from pound

image.altText: A child holding paper cups over a wind contraption.

props.synopsis: Questacon's ZAP! CLANK! POW! uses a comic book theme to link 17 interactive displays on electricity, machines and motion, including some old favourites from the past 37 years.

title.children: Questacon classics brought together in new hands-on exhibition

image.altText: Anthony Albanese visits Situation Room with Kirty McBain and Richard Marles

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says the federal government will not sign a free trade deal with the European Union if it's not in Australia's interests as talks between the two restart. Follow live.

title.children: PM says he doesn't want Australia-EU free trade deal 'at any cost'

image.altText: liberal candidate for bradfield votes on election day at a polling booth

props.synopsis: Still not conceding defeat, the Liberal Party is weighing up whether to challenge Gisele Kapterian's narrow loss in Bradfield in court.

title.children: Liberal Party weighing up legal challenge after 26-vote loss

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: James Wood, 34, was arrested yesterday in connection with the disappearance of Pheobe Bishop, who has not been seen or heard from since May 15.

title.children: Housemate of missing teenager Pheobe Bishop released without charge

image.altText: Three silhouettes of a woman's head and shoulders in front of a window

props.synopsis: The Newcastle man has been sentenced after a trial that involved two siblings, including a daughter who gave evidence as different personalities.

title.children: 21 years' jail for father whose abuse led to daughter's multiple personalities

image.altText: Picture of Australian one dollar coins stacked on top of note currency

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar is touching 65 US cents on Thursday. Meanwhile, new figures show mining exploration investment in Australia is at its lowest level in years. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar rises above 65 US cents, RBA rate cut predicted for July

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Toys R Us appoints voluntary administrators

image.altText: A military official stands over a desk looking at maps showing Russia airfield locations.

props.synopsis: Military analysts say Ukraine's audacious attack on Russian air bases marks the next phase in tactical drone warfare, and all countries — including Australia — need to take note.

title.children: Australia told to take note as Ukraine marks new era in drone warfare

image.altText: Donald Trump standing next to three men in bright orange protective clothing inspecting a wheel of steel cable

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's increased tariffs on steel and aluminium products imported into the United States are now in effect, meaning foreign importers face 50 per cent levies on top of their current costs.

title.children: Trump spruiks his 'success' since inauguration as steel tariffs take effect

image.altText: Donald Trump points.

props.synopsis: A rift is brewing within the US Republican Party as President Donald Trump attempts to muscle his Big, Beautiful Bill through Congress.

title.children: Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' is dividing Republicans. Here's what it contains

image.altText: Crash Body by Paula Garcia

props.synopsis: Tasmania's iconic winter festival gets underway today, with free experiences hidden across Hobart in disused churches, basements and even a Freemasons lodge.

title.children: Where to find free art as 'behemoth' Dark Mofo festival kicks off

image.altText: An elderly man in silhouette sitting in a chair looking at trees.

props.synopsis: Blue Care says the impact of aged care reforms mean some roles are no longer viable or required, as it makes job cuts aimed at "operational sustainability".

title.children: Major aged care provider to cut more jobs ahead of government reforms

image.altText: A Pacific Island man wearing a white shirt lies on the ground after a knockout tackle during a Run It Straight contest

props.synopsis: As this trend spreads, concerns are growing about the risks of brain injuries and the intense pressure on young men to prove themselves.

title.children: Run It Straight shows that 'bodies are disposable, pain is performative'

image.altText: A sign is seen just above the high water mark in a flooded regional road.

props.synopsis: Farmers say the recent floods in NSW were unprecedented and exhausting, but some stop short of blaming climate change.

title.children: What can be done about the 'new world' of extreme weather?

image.altText: Safety tape is seen cordoning off a four-storey building with visible fire damage to the top floor

props.synopsis: New Zealand Police have charged three people with manslaughter over the May 2023 boarding house fire in Wellington that killed five people.

title.children: NZ police lay manslaughter charges over deadly hostel fire

image.altText: A gloved hand and tweezers hold a fragment of a manuscript written in Hebrew.

props.synopsis: A new study has used AI to decipher the age of the Dead Sea Scrolls, potentially rewriting what we know about when some of the world's most precious biblical texts were created.

title.children: Age of Dead Sea Scrolls pinned down with the help of AI

image.altText: woman putting suitcase on the scale to check luggage

props.synopsis: When it comes to planning an overseas trip, deciding how you're going to access your money can seem overwhelming. Experts outline your options.

title.children: How 'traveller-friendly' is your credit or debit card?

image.altText: A purple and blue bus with 'Play Bold' on the side approaching a large crowd of fans with their arms in the air

props.synopsis: The crush happened as thousands of fans gathered outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium to celebrate the winners of the world's most popular T20 cricket tournament.

title.children: Stampede at Indian stadium following IPL win leaves at least 11 fans dead

image.altText: Novak Djokovic pumps his right fist as he celebrates defeating Alexander Zverev.

props.synopsis: Three-time champion Novak Djokovic keeps up his quest for a record-breaking 25th major singles title, advancing to the French Open semifinals where he will face top seed Jannik Sinner.

title.children: Djokovic to face Sinner in blockbuster French Open clash

image.altText: Charlie Murray playing for Western Suburbs Magpies.

props.synopsis: Charlie Murray says helping his Wests Tigers teammates beat Penrith is more important than fixing their books, as the finance broker gears up for his NRL debut.

title.children: Finance broker to make NRL debut after almost 70 reserve grade matches

image.altText: Two men celebrate with the NRL premiership trophy

props.synopsis: Nathan Cleary and Jarome Luai drove Penrith to unfathomable heights together but now the two will face off in the NRL for the first time with both their seasons at a crossroads.

title.children: Once brothers in arms, Cleary and Luai set for first meeting as NRL foes

image.altText: GettyImages-1796369238

props.synopsis: The Finnish women's football team coach apologises after accidentally naming a retired 51-year-old in a game against Serbia.

title.children: Finnish coach apologises after accidentally naming retired 51yo

image.altText: Giant metal pipes form part of the Karratha gas plant, with two workers dwarfed by its size.

props.synopsis: The government expected to raise an additional $2.4 billion over four years thanks to changes to the tax on oil and gas profits. It is now predicting it will raise $4 billion less over that same time.

title.children: Calls to revisit oil and gas tax after government revises intake down $4b

image.altText: A black and white photo of Meghan Markle holding a child with windy hair.

props.synopsis: The Duchess of Sussex shared photos of the princess for her fourth birthday.

title.children: Meghan marks Lilibet's birthday with personal images, pregnant dancing video

image.altText: NSW Housing Minister Rose Jackson stands behind a microphone at an outdoor presser

props.synopsis: The problems in the system have been laid out and there's a growing chorus of voices demanding urgent action before more lives are lost.

title.children: NSW govt defends 'broken' mental health system using misleading figure

image.altText: An anopheles mosquito.

props.synopsis: A second locally acquired malaria case was recently identified in the Torres Strait Islands.

title.children: Queensland Health investigating locally acquired malaria cases

image.altText: Australia's Trade Minister Don Farrell stands with trade ministers from the EU

props.synopsis: A pact with the bloc was "about building economic resilience in a rapidly changing global environment," Don Farrell said.

title.children: Australia and EU revive trade talks but agriculture still a sticking point
